message:
Implement access controls using IAM policies for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Define fine-grained IAM policies to control access to S3 buckets. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/s3-access-control.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/s3-access-control.html)

Enable S3 bucket access logging (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable S3 bucket access logging to track all access to the bucket. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html)

Enable MFA delete for S3 buckets (CIS AWS Foundations): Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for bucket deletion. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable logging of object-level APIs for S3 buckets (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Enable AWS CloudTrail to log object-level APIs for S3 buckets. URL: [https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf)

Enable S3 bucket versioning (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Enable versioning for S3 buckets to maintain object versions. URL: [https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf)

Enable server-side encryption using AES-256 for S3 buckets (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use server-side encryption (SSE) with AES-256 to protect data at rest. URL: [https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf)

Enable bucket-level public access block for S3 buckets (CIS AWS Foundations): Configure bucket policies to block public access to S3 buckets. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable server-side encryption using AWS KMS for S3 buckets (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use server-side encryption (SSE) with AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to protect data at rest. URL: [https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf)

Enable S3 bucket access logging and object-level logging (CIS AWS Foundations): Enable S3 bucket access logging and CloudTrail logging for object-level APIs. URL: [https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf](https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf)

Enable default encryption for S3 buckets using AWS KMS (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Set a default encryption option using AWS KMS to encrypt new objects in S3 buckets. URL: [https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf](https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf)

Enable S3 bucket replication for data redundancy and disaster recovery (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure S3 bucket replication to replicate data across regions. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/crr.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/crr.html)

Restrict public access to S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to deny public access. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/security-best-practices.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/security-best-practices.html)

Enable versioning for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable versioning to maintain a history of object modifications. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-versioning.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-versioning.html)

Enable logging for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable server access logging to track requests made to S3 buckets. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html)

Enable data events for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Use AWS CloudTrail to capture S3 data events for auditing and security analysis. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/cloudtrail-logging.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/cloudtrail-logging.html)

Enable encryption in transit for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Enable SSL/TLS to encrypt data sent to and from S3. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingEncryption.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingEncryption.html)

Enable server-side encryption for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Use server-side encryption (SSE) to protect data at rest in S3 buckets. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/serv-side-encryption.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/serv-side-encryption.html)

Enable default encryption for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Set a default encryption option to automatically encrypt all new objects in S3 buckets. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/bucket-encryption.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/bucket-encryption.html)

Enable AWS Security Hub integration for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Integrate S3 buckets with AWS Security Hub for centralized security monitoring. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/securityhub-integration.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/securityhub-integration.html)

Enable Amazon GuardDuty integration for S3 buckets (AWS Security Best Practices): Integrate S3 buckets with Amazon GuardDuty for threat detection and monitoring. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/guardduty-integration.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/guardduty-integration.html)

Enable S3 bucket notifications (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure notifications to track and receive updates on S3 bucket activities. URL: [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/NotificationHowTo.html](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/NotificationHowTo.html)

List security controls for Amazon S3 based on guidelines from CIS, NIST, AWS Security Best Practices, and STIGs. Use direct imperative commands, focusing on access management, encryption, monitoring, and network controls. For each control, include the specific source and a URL for direct access to additional details. Omit introductions, conclusions, comments, and warnings about content limitations.

Examples:

Implement the principle of least privilege for IAM permissions (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure IAM policies for S3 are restricted to necessary operations. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for object deletion (CIS AWS Foundations): Require multi-factor authentication to delete objects. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in S3 (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use AWS S3 SSE to protect data at rest. URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

Use policies to enforce encryption on upload (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure bucket policies to reject unencrypted object uploads. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html
